  • Changelog

    Split the hippocampal dataset to dorsal and ventral regions.

    split_hipp_DV.Rd

    If normalize_cell_counts() has already been run, the existing hippocampus data will be deleted and either replaced with new dorsal/ventral hippocampus data when merge = TRUE (recommended) or it will be stored in a separate dataframe if the user wants analyze the hippocampus separately for analysis and the normalized_counts dataframe will be unchanged.

    Usage

    split_hipp_DV(
  m,
  AP_coord = -2.7,
  combine_hemispheres = TRUE,
  merge = TRUE,
  simplify_regions = TRUE,
  simplify_keywords = c("layer", "part", "stratum", "division"),
  rois = c("DG", "CA1", "CA2", "CA3")
)

    Arguments

    m

    mouse object

    AP_coord

    (double) The AP coordinate which separates dorsal hippocampus from ventral hippocampus. Counts anterior to this are considered dorsal, counts posterior to this are considered ventral.

    combine_hemispheres

    (bool, default = TRUE) Combine normalized cell counts from both hemispheres

    merge

    (bool, default = TRUE) Recommended setting. Whether to include the division of dHipp and vHipp into the normalized counts dataframe of the mouse or to store as a separate element for isolated analysis. Merging will replace the hippocampal counts currently in the normalized counts table. Not merging will create a separate data element in the mouse. TODO: Currently not functional.

    simplify_regions

    (bool, default = TRUE ) simplify the normalized region counts based on keywords in the internal function, simplify_keywords

    simplify_keywords

    (str, default = c("layer","part","stratum","division")). Keywords to search through region names and simplify to parent structure

    rois

    (str, default = c("DG", "CA1", "CA2", "CA3")) List of the region acronyms to include in the hippocampus

    Value

    m mouse object with DV cell counts from the hippocampus included

    On this page
